chart_description: This chart shows the time spent for handling MQTT, WSS, SSL and network communication related operations for the Netdata Active Clock (aclk) module.

dimension_descriptions.keep-alive: The time spent for keep-alive operations in microseconds. Keep-alive is a mechanism used to maintain active network connections between the client and the server.
dimension_descriptions.process_mqtt: The time spent for processing MQTT messages in microseconds. MQTT is a lightweight messaging protocol used for machine-to-machine communication.
dimension_descriptions.process_websocket: The time spent for processing WebSocket messages in microseconds. WebSocket is a protocol used for real-time communication between a client and a server.
dimension_descriptions.socket_read_ssl: The time spent for reading data from a SSL socket in microseconds. SSL (Secure Socket Layer) is a protocol used for securing communication over the internet.
dimension_descriptions.socket_write_ssl: The time spent for writing data to a SSL socket in microseconds. SSL (Secure Socket Layer) is a protocol used for securing communication over the internet.
